subject: Public Speaking
title: The Default Mode Network and Rumination
description: A fast breakdown of The Default Mode Network and Rumination for builders.

hook.text: The night before a big speech, your brain won't stop rehearsing disaster scenarios. That's your default mode network.

buildup.text: The DMN activates when you're not focused on a task. It wanders â€” and for anxious people, it wanders to threats.

discovery.text: Pre-speech rumination feels like preparation. But it's actually your brain rehearsing failure, not success.

twist.text: Engaging in a focused task â€” even unrelated â€” quiets the DMN. Busy brains ruminate less than idle ones.

climax.text: The worst thing you can do before a speech is sit alone with your thoughts. Activity beats meditation for many.

punchline.text: An idle brain rehearses failure on autopilot.

quiz.question: What does the default mode network do before a speech?
options: Often generates worry and failure scenarios
